page.title: 05The Ecology of Ringmer
page.content: Ringmer is situated at the foot of{ {chalk downland}in a clay vale containing small ponds and streams. {Plant and animal habitats}have been reduced by : building of new estates, use of pesticides, destruction of hedgerows, piping of streams under- ground, filling in of small ponds. Indiscriminate picking of{wild flowers has reduced numbers of plants rather than varieties. Recently there has been an effective effort to educate children in conservation.{Cowslips } and{orchids}grow on the downs. The death of almost all{elm trees}by{Dutch {Elm Disease}has dramatically altered the landscape. The area hosts a rich and varied{fauna}including numerous species of butterflies, birds and other animals.{Glow-worms}no longer seen but remembered by the elderly.
